Hi, you will have to do another API call to get the properties of associated objects, you can use batch read as you already know the IDs: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/crm-custom-objects>

Error message says it all - there is no vp_feedback deal property in the account you are sending the request to.
I would also recommend not posting your Bearer token here as someone can use it to spoil your environment.
You can do this <https://pastebin.com/kqNFKpgp>
In short: Loop requests until there is no more records left

Hi everyone, i’m sorry if this is a common question but I am trying to get the HubSpot gem up and running on rails using a private app access token. I have a test HubSpot account and have created an integration where I created a private app with what I think are the correct scopes.

Using CURL and the access token i’m able to get the sample clients from the crm endpoint.
```curl --request GET --url '<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/contacts?limit=10&archived=false>' --header 'authorization: Bearer pat-eu1-XXXXXXXXXXXXXXXXX'```
Where I get this response (seems correct)
```{"results":[{"id":"1","properties":{"createdate":"2022-12-13T12:56:56.828Z","email":"<mailto:emailmaria@HubSpot.com|emailmaria@HubSpot.com>","firstname":"Maria","hs_object_id":"1","lastmodifieddate":"2022-12-13T12:57:10.815Z","lastname":"Johnson (Sample Contact)"},"createdAt":"2022-12-13T12:56:56.828Z","updatedAt":"2022-12-13T12:57:10.815Z","archived":false},{"id":"51","properties":{"createdate":"2022-12-13T12:56:57.164Z","email":"<mailto:bh@HubSpot.com|bh@HubSpot.com>","firstname":"Brian","hs_object_id":"51","lastmodifieddate":"2022-12-13T12:57:10.880Z","lastname":"Halligan (Sample Contact)"},"createdAt":"2022-12-13T12:56:57.164Z","updatedAt":"2022-12-13T12:57:10.880Z","archived":false}]}%```
However when I try to initialize the client and call the same endpoint with the HubSpot gem, i’m always getting a 401 error.

```client = HubSpot::Client.new(access_token: ENV['HubSpot_ACCESS_TOKEN'])

client.crm.contacts.basic_api.get_all```
and I get this response:

```Error message: the server returns an error
HTTP status code: 401
Response headers: {"date"=>"Tue, 13 Dec 2022 13:44:27 GMT", "content-type"=>"application/json;charset=utf-8", "content-length"=>"316", "cf-ray"=>"778f2272e886abe7-CPH", "strict-transport-security"=>"max-age=31536000; includeSubDomains; preload", "vary"=>"origin", "cf-cache-status"=>"DYNAMIC", "access-control-allow-credentials"=>"false", "x-HubSpot-auth-failure"=>"401 Unauthorized", "x-HubSpot-correlation-id"=>"3c9ee883-159d-41e0-9b8a-ff35b552785b", "x-trace"=>"2BE386BA3564E240753E2BA057BCB0600667188EC9000000000000000000", "report-to"=>"{\"endpoints\":[{\"url\":\"https:\\/\\/a.nel.cloudflare.com\\/report\\/v3?s=FyGisgU6ASkIvxskvO%2Fau7sQLRkeBh8l2vdK0qvcNhYu0p5vAzDBf3cglPMuV4HxjtMGGHVzkSlXPWCkelEllph3F9v0BdisferI3vywhigia%2FcIPfnNrVMMQVkH72Ep\"}],\"group\":\"cf-nel\",\"max_age\":604800}", "nel"=>"{\"success_fraction\":0.01,\"report_to\":\"cf-nel\",\"max_age\":604800}", "server"=>"cloudflare", "alt-svc"=>"h3=\":443\"; ma=86400, h3-29=\":443\"; ma=86400"}
Response body: {"status":"error","message":"Authentication credentials not found. This API supports both API Key and OAuth 2.0 authentication and you can find more details at <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/auth/oauth-overview>","correlationId":"3c9ee883-159d-41e0-9b8a-ff35b552785b","category":"INVALID_AUTHENTICATION"}```
Does anybody have some knowledge with the rails gem that would help me out?

I apologize for the long message, i’ve been given a deadline and am in a pickle :grimacing:
GraphQL might have limit of 500 contact :thinking_face:  at least when I tested it. But that’s 5x better still. Let me know if you find solution! I’m also interested.

Dear HubSpot: Why does the search API have a limit on the amount of characters you can enter in a "VALUE"? Without a "LIKE" operator, it makes the search API kinda useless for bigger blocks of data.

:wave: Hello, everyone! I am creating an API for a Rails app using <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-ruby|HubSpot-api-client> and following this <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts|documentation>. I am able to create Objects, but cannot get them associated no matter what I try.
This is the exact code from the example that I run
```require 'HubSpot-api-client'

api_client = HubSpot::Client.new(access_token: 'YOUR_ACCESS_TOKEN')

api_response = api_client.crm.contacts.associations_api.create(contact_id: 100, to_object_type: "toObjectType", to_object_id: 100, array_of_association_spec: [{"associationCategory":"HubSpot_DEFINED","associationTypeId":0}])
puts api_response```
but I keep getting this error
```Traceback (most recent call last):
        2: from (irb):16
        1: from (irb):17:in `rescue in irb_binding'
LoadError (cannot load such file -- HubSpot/codegen/crm/deals/models/association_type)```
After inspecting the gem itself I do not see the `association_type` file anywhere <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-api-ruby/tree/master/lib/HubSpot/codegen/crm/deals/models>.
Was there a change to the gem that was not reflected in the API documentation? Am I doing something wrong?
